alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 4:16PM EDT until March 27 at 12:43AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Georgia... Falling Creek near Juliette affecting Jones County. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Juliette...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Falling Creek near Juliette. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 19 feet, Significant flooding expands into the woodlands along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. The rapid flow almost triples in volume compared to the flood stage level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 6.9 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 02/19/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
